SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Game extends Object implements Serializable
Represents the main game instance with its state and components. This class manages players, modifications, decks of cards, game state, and communication with clients.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • reconnection

      public void reconnection(String nickname, VirtualView oldVirtualView, VirtualView newVirtualView) throws RemoteException
      Handles the reconnection of a player with a new VirtualView instance. Updates the player's VirtualView and notifies listeners accordingly.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player reconnecting.
      oldVirtualView - The old VirtualView instance associated with the player.
      newVirtualView - The new VirtualView instance to associate with the player.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote communication error occurs.

    • disconnection

      public void disconnection(String playerName) throws RemoteException
      Handles the disconnection of a player. This method sets the player's online status to false, informs the player and the associated virtual view of the disconnection, and checks the count of online players. If no players is online, the system exits. If the disconnected player is the current player, it proceeds to the next player.
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player who is disconnecting.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs.

    • nextPlayer

      public void nextPlayer() throws RemoteException
      Advances to the next player in the game. This method increments the current player index to point to the next player. If the current player index exceeds the number of players, it checks the game state. If the game state is LASTROUND, it sets the game state to FINALSCORE. If the next player is online, it notifies the listener to place the next player. If no other player is found online, it sets the wait flag.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs.

    • getInstance

      public static Game getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the Game class. This method ensures that only one instance of the Game class is created (singleton pattern). If the instance does not exist, it creates a new one.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance of the Game class.

      public ArrayList<GoldCard> getCommonGold()
      Gets the list of common gold cards.

    • getPlayers

      public ArrayList<Player> getPlayers()
      Gets the list of players.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Player objects representing the players in the game.

    • getGameState

      public GameState getGameState()
      Gets the current state of the game.
      Returns:
      the GameState object representing the current state of the game.

    • setGameState

      public void setGameState(GameState gs) throws RemoteException
      Sets the current state of the game. If the game state is set to GAME, it notifies the listener to place the current player. If the game state is set to FINALSCORE, it calculates the end points.
      Parameters:
      gs - the new GameState to set.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs.

    • getCurrPlayer

      public int getCurrPlayer()
      Gets the index of the current player.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the index of the current player.

    • getPlayersNumber

      public int getPlayersNumber()
      Gets the number of players in the game.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the number of players.

    • popAchievementCard

      public AchievementCard popAchievementCard()
      Pops an achievement card from the achievement deck. This method removes and returns the top card from the achievement deck. If the deck is empty, it returns null.
      Returns:
      the AchievementCard object from the top of the deck, or null if the deck is empty.

    • popGoldCard

      public GoldCard popGoldCard()
      Pops a gold card from the gold deck. This method removes and returns the top card from the gold deck. If the deck is empty, it returns null.
      Returns:
      the GoldCard object from the top of the deck, or null if the deck is empty.

    • popResourceCard

      public ResourceCard popResourceCard()
      Pops a resource card from the resource deck. This method removes and returns the top card from the resource deck. If the deck is empty, it returns null.
      Returns:
      the ResourceCard object from the top of the deck, or null if the deck is empty.

    • popStarterCard

      public StarterCard popStarterCard()
      Pops a starter card from the starter deck. This method removes and returns the top card from the starter deck. If the deck is empty, it returns null.
      Returns:
      the StarterCard object from the top of the deck, or null if the deck is empty.

    • addPlayers

      public void addPlayers(ArrayList<Player> players, ArrayList<VirtualView> clients) throws RemoteException
      Method that given an arraylist of players, assign them a color, shuffle their order and add em to the game
      Parameters:
      players - arraylist of players who will play in the game
      Throws:
      RemoteException

    • setStarterCard

      public void setStarterCard(String playerName, boolean front) throws RemoteException
      Sets the starter card for a specific player. This method finds the player by name, retrieves their starter card, sets the card's front side based on the provided boolean, and resets the player's playground area with the updated starter card. It also notifies the listener of the achievement choice for the player.
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player whose starter card is to be set.
      front - a boolean indicating whether the front side of the starter card should be set.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs.

    • setCurrPlayer

      public void setCurrPlayer(Player p)
      Sets the current player to the specified player. This method sets the current player index to the index of the specified player in the players list. It is intended for testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      p - the Player object to set as the current player.

    • nextState

      public void nextState()
      Advances the game state to the next state. This method transitions the game state to the next phase in the game flow. The transitions are as follows: LOBBY -> INIT -> READY -> SELECTACHIEVEMENT -> GAME -> LASTROUND -> FINALSCORE -> END. When the game reaches the END state, it calls the dispose method to clean up.

    • end

      public void end()
      Ends the game immediately. Method intended for testing purposes and should only be used to force the game into the END state. Sets the game state to END, triggering the dispose method to clean up and terminate the game.

    • draw

      public Card draw(String name, int index) throws RemoteException
      Given the name of a player and an index representing his choice, this method removes a card from the table and adds it to the hand of the player
      Parameters:
      index - integer representing the choice, 1-2 gold , 3-4 resources, 5-6 decks
      Returns:
      Card or null if indexOutOfBound or position empty
      Throws:
      RemoteException

    • calculateEndPoints

      public void calculateEndPoints() throws RemoteException
      Calculates the end game points and determines the winners. This method calculates the final points for each player based on their secret achievements, common achievements, and total points. It then determines the maximum points and checks for ties among players. If there is a tie in total points, it further checks the points from the highest scoring player's achievements to determine the winners. Finally, it notifies the listener about the winners.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs.
